functions.label: chatSystemIndex
description: Helper function to define chat system indices.

functions.label: createErrorResult
signature: (message: string | { message: string; stack?: unknown; metadata?: Record<string, unknown> | undefined; }) =>

children.label: message
signature: string | { message: string; stack?: unknown; metadata?: Record<string, unknown> | undefined; }

functions.label: getToolResultId
description: Generate a random id which can be used for tool result id.

functions.label: isToolResultId
description: Check if the provided string is a valid tool result id.

children.label: request
description:
The request that was provided when initiating that tool execution.
Can be used to create scoped services not directly exposed by this context.

children.label: spaceId
description: Id of the space associated with the request

children.label: esClient
description:
A cluster client scoped to the current user.
Can be used to access ES on behalf of either the current user or the system user.

children.label: modelProvider
description:
Inference model provider scoped to the current user.
Can be used to access the inference APIs or chatModel.

children.label: toolProvider
description: Tool provider that can be used to list or execute tools.

children.label: runner
description: AgentBuilder runner scoped to the current execution.

children.label: attachments
description: Attachment service to interact with attachments.

children.label: resultStore
description: Result store to access and add tool results during execution.

children.label: attachmentStateManager
description: Attachment state manager to manage conversation attachments during execution.

children.label: promptManager
description: Used to manage interruptions.

children.label: stateManager
description: Used to access and store state during interrupted executions.

children.label: events
description: Event emitter that can be used to emits custom events

children.label: logger
description: Logger scoped to this execution

children.label: agentParams
description: The params that the agent execution API was called with

children.label: runId
description: ID of this run

children.label: abortSignal
description: optional signal to abort the execution of the agent

children.label: result
description: The plain result of the agent

interfaces.label: BuiltinToolDefinition
description: Built-in tool, as registered as static tool.

children.label: type
description: built-in tool types

children.label: schema
description: Tool's input schema, defined as a zod schema.

children.label: handler
description: Handler to call to execute the tool.

children.label: availability
description:
Optional dynamic availability configuration.
Refer to {@link ToolAvailabilityConfig}

children.label: summarizeToolReturn
description:
Optional function to summarize a tool return for conversation history.
When provided, this function will be called when processing conversation history
to replace large tool results with compact summaries.
This helps prevent context bloat in long conversations.

interfaces.label: ExecutableTool
description: AgentBuilder tool, as exposed by tool providers.

children.label: getSchema
description: Tool's input schema, defined as a zod schema.

children.label: execute
description: Run handler that can be used to execute the tool.

children.label: params
signature: | undefined; toolParams: TParams; toolCallId?: string | undefined; defaultConnectorId?: string | undefined; }

children.label: getLlmDescription
description:
Optional handled to add additional instructions to the LLM.
When provided, will replace the description when converting to llm tool.

interfaces.label: InternalToolDefinition
description: Internal generic representation for a tool definition

children.label: isAvailable
description: Check if the tool is available for the current context.

children.label: getSchema
description: Generates the schema attached to this tool.

children.label: getHandler
description: Get the handler which can be used to execute the tool.

children.label: getLlmDescription
description:
Optional handled to add additional instructions to the LLM
when specified, this will fully replace the description when converting to LLM tools.

children.label: summarizeToolReturn
description:
Optional function to summarize a tool return for conversation history.
When provided, this function will be called when processing conversation history
to replace large tool results with compact summaries.

children.label: confirmation
description: Tool call policy to control tool call confirmation behavior

interfaces.label: ModelProvider
description: Provider, allowing to select various models depending on the needs.

children.label: getDefaultModel
description: Returns the model used for LLM tasks in the current round.

children.label: getModel
description:
Returns a model using the given connectorId.

Will throw if connector doesn't exist, user has no access, or connector
is not a GenAI connector.

children.label: getUsageStats
description: Returns the current usage stats for the model provider.

interfaces.label: RunAgentParams
description: Params for {@link RunAgentFn}

children.label: agentId
description: ID of the agent to call.

children.label: agentParams
description: Parameters to call the agent with.

children.label: onEvent
description: Optional event handler.

children.label: abortSignal
description: Optional signal to abort the execution of the agent.

children.label: request
description: The request that initiated that run.

children.label: defaultConnectorId
description:
Optional genAI connector id to use as default.
If unspecified, will use internal logic to use the default connector

children.label: result
description: return from the agent

interfaces.label: RunContext
description:
Context bound to a run execution.
Contains metadata associated with the run's current state.
Will be attached to errors thrown during a run.

children.label: runId
description: The run identifier, which can be used for tracing

children.label: stack
description: The current execution stack

interfaces.label: Runner
description:
Represents a runner, which is the entry point to execute all agentBuilder primitives,
such as tools or agents.

This version is not scoped to a given request, and is the version exposed from the plugin's contract.

children.label: runTool
description: Execute a tool (based on its ID).

children.label: runInternalTool
description: Execute an internal tool definition.

children.label: runAgent
description: Execute an agent;

interfaces.label: RunToolParams
description: Params for {@link RunToolFn}

children.label: toolId
description: ID of the tool to call.

children.label: toolParams
description: Parameters to call the tool with.

children.label: toolCallId
description: Optional toolCall id associated with the tool invocation.

children.label: source
description:
Optional source of the tool invocation.
Defaults to 'unknown'.

children.label: promptState
description: Optional prompt storage state to use for tool invocation.

children.label: onEvent
description: Optional event handler.

children.label: request
description: The request that initiated that run.

children.label: defaultConnectorId
description:
Optional genAI connector id to use as default.
If unspecified, will use internal logic to use the default connector
(EIS if there, otherwise openAI, otherwise any GenAI)

interfaces.label: RunToolReturn
description:
Return type for tool invocation APIs.

Wrapping the plain result to allow extending the shape later without
introducing breaking changes.

children.label: results
description: The result value as returned by the tool.

children.label: prompt
description: Interruption returned by the tool

interfaces.label: ScopedModel
description:
Represents a model that can be used within the agentBuilder framework (e.g. tools).

It exposes different interfaces to models.

children.label: connector
description: The connector bound to this scoped model.

children.label: chatModel
description: langchain chat model.

children.label: inferenceClient
description: Inference client.

interfaces.label: ScopedRunner
description:
Represents a runner, which is the entry point to execute all agentBuilder primitives,
such as tools or agents.

This version is pre-scoped to a given request, meaning APIs don't need to be passed
down a request object.

children.label: runTool
description: Execute a tool (based on its ID).

children.label: params
signature: | undefined; toolId: string; toolParams: TParams; toolCallId?: string | undefined; defaultConnectorId?: string | undefined; }

children.label: runInternalTool
description: Execute an internal tool definition.

children.label: params
signature: | undefined; toolParams: TParams; toolCallId?: string | undefined; defaultConnectorId?: string | undefined; tool:

children.label: runAgent
description: Execute an agent

children.label: params
signature: | undefined; agentId: string; defaultConnectorId?: string | undefined; agentParams:

children.label: handler
description:
handler which can be defined to add conditional availability of the tool.

Note: this is meant to be used for tools that are gated behind a feature flag,
      or tools which have some condition to be available.
      it *IS NOT* meant to be used as a replacement for RBAC.

children.label: cacheMode
description:
Cache mode for the result
- global: the result will be cached globally, for all spaces
- space: the result will be cached per-space
- none: the result shouldn't be cached (warning: this can lead to performance issues)

children.label: cacheTtl
description:
Optional TTL for the cached result, *in seconds*.
Default to 300 seconds (5 minutes).

interfaces.label: ToolAvailabilityContext
description: Information exposed to the {@link ToolAvailabilityHandler}.

interfaces.label: ToolAvailabilityResult
description: Information exposed to the {@link ToolAvailabilityHandler}.

children.label: status
description: Whether the tool is available or not.

children.label: reason
description: Optional reason for why the tool is unavailable.

interfaces.label: ToolEventEmitter
description: Tool event emitter, exposed to tool handlers

children.label: reportProgress
description: Emit a tool progress event based on the provided progress text.

children.label: sendUiEvent
description:
Emit a UI event which can be listened to on the front-end.

Note: UI events aren't persisted, they are just meant to be used during streaming by the UI.
signature: <TEvent extends string, TData extends object>(event: TEvent, data: TData) => void

interfaces.label: ToolHandlerContext
description:
Scoped context which can be used during tool execution to access
a panel of built-in services, such as a pre-scoped elasticsearch client.

children.label: request
description:
The request that was provided when initiating that tool execution.
Can be used to create scoped services not directly exposed by this context.

children.label: spaceId
description: Id of the space associated with the request

children.label: esClient
description:
A cluster client scoped to the current user.
Can be used to access ES on behalf of either the current user or the system user.

children.label: modelProvider
description:
Inference model provider scoped to the current user.
Can be used to access the inference APIs or chatModel.

children.label: toolProvider
description: Tool provider that can be used to list or execute tools.

children.label: runner
description: AgentBuilder runner scoped to the current execution.

children.label: resultStore
description: Result store to access tool results during execution.

children.label: events
description: Event emitter that can be used to emits custom events

children.label: logger
description: Logger scoped to this execution

children.label: prompts
description: Service used to send and read interruptions.

children.label: stateManager
description: Manager to store/load tool state during interrupted executions.

children.label: checkConfirmationStatus
description: Get the status for the given confirmation prompt

children.label: askForConfirmation
description: Creates a confirmation prompt which can be returned by the tool handler

interfaces.label: ToolProvider
description: Common interface shared across all tool providers.

children.label: has
description: Check if a tool is available in the provider

children.label: get
description:
Retrieve a tool based on its identifier.
If not found, will throw a toolNotFound error.

children.label: list
description: List all tools based on the provided filters

interfaces.label: ToolProviderGetOptions
description: Options for {@link ToolProvider.get}

interfaces.label: ToolProviderHasOptions
description: Options for {@link ToolProvider.has}

interfaces.label: ToolProviderListOptions
description: Options for {@link ToolProvider.list}

interfaces.label: ToolResultStore
description: Store to access tool results during execution

interfaces.label: ToolStateManager
description:
Tool state manager - Which can be used to persist state between executions of the tool.

Note: state is bound to a tool call, and not shared between multiple calls to the same tool.

children.label: getState
description:
Retrieve the state which was stored during the previous execution of the tool.
This is only useful when interrupting the tool to prompt the user,
to retrieve the state when the execution is resumed.

children.label: setState
description:
Persist the internal state of the tool execution, to be retrieved when execution is resumed.
This is only useful when interrupting the tool to prompt the user.

interfaces.label: WritableToolResultStore
description: Writable version of ToolResultStore, used internally by the runner/agent

misc.label: AgentEventEmitterFn
description: Event handler function to listen to run events during execution of tools, agents or other agentBuilder primitives.

misc.label: chatSystemIndexPrefix
description:
Prefix of the chat system indices.

The Kibana system user has the same permission on those indices than it has on Kibana system indices.

misc.label: ToolAvailabilityHandler
description: Availability handler for a tool.

misc.label: ToolEventHandlerFn
description: Event handler function to listen to run events during execution of tools, agents or other agentBuilder primitives.

description: Tool result as returned by the tool handler.

misc.label: ToolHandlerReturn
description: Return value for {@link ToolHandlerFn} / {@link BuiltinToolDefinition}

misc.label: ToolReturnSummarizerFn
description:
Function to summarize a tool return for conversation history.
Used to reduce context size by replacing large tool results with compact summaries.

This function receives all results from a single tool call, allowing it to
aggregate and summarize multiple results together (e.g., converting 10 search
results into a single summary like "search returned 10 docs, ids are: ...").
returnComment: The summarized results, or undefined if no summarization should be applied

children.label: toolReturn
description: - All results from a single tool call
